title: Hadiya Hossana F.C.
text:
Hadiya Hossana Football Club (<a href="Amharic">Amharic</a>: ሀዲያ ሆሳዕና እግር ኳስ ክለብ) is a professional Ethiopian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club based in <a href="Hosaena">Hosaena</a>. They currently play in the <a href="Ethiopian%20Premier%20League">Ethiopian Premier League</a>, the first division of football in Ethiopia.
History.
The club was founded in 2006 (1998 <a href="Ethiopian%20calendar">E.C.</a>). Prior to the start of the 2018-19 season the club announced Girma Tadesse, previously the manager of <a href="Debub%20Police%20S.C.">Debub Police</a>, as their new Manager.
In the 2016-17 season, Hadiya Hossana finished second in group B of the Ethiopian Higher League gaining 53 points in the process. This earned them a spot in a playoff game against Mekelle City FC, the runners up in group A of the Higher League, with the winner being the third and final club promoted to the Ethiopian Premier League that season. The playoff game was held at a neutral site in <a href="Dire%20Dawa">Dire Dawa</a> city and finished 2-1 in favor of Mekelle City meaning Hadiya Hossana would stay in Higher League.
The club had an impressive start to its <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20Ethiopian%20Premier%20League">2020-21 season</a>, winning its first 4 games of the season.
Stadium.
Hadiya Hossana play their home matches at Abiy Hersamo Memorial Stadium.
Players.
First-team squad.
"As of 6 January 2021"
Club Officials.
Coaching Staff.
Manager/Head coach: <a href="Ashenafi%20Bekele">Ashenafi Bekele</a>
Assistant Coach: Iyasu Merhatsidk
Team Leader: Melkamu Tsegaye
Team Medic: Tamre Hundito 
<a href="Physiotherapist">Physiotherapist</a>: Benyam Tefera
